Alternatively, if you're interested in a more contemporary narrative, "Hitch" (2005) is a comedy-drama film starring Will Smith that touches upon themes of love and self-discovery, though it might not be as directly focused on bisexuality as your preference. Enjoy the movies!

This movie is a thrilling mystery set in both Copenhagen and Greenland, following a half-Inuit woman who investigates the death of a young Inuit boy.

Alternatively, if you enjoy suspenseful and character-driven stories, "The Hours" featuring Meryl Streep, Julianne Moore, and Nicole Kidman might be worth checking out. This film explores the lives of three women connected by Virginia Woolf's novel "Mrs. Dalloway," dealing with themes of love, loss, and suicide across different generations.

It's an engaging film about a diverse group of soldiers who risk their lives during World War II to rescue and protect priceless pieces of art from the Nazis. The star-studded cast includes stars like George Clooney, Matt Damon, and Bill Murray.

Another thoughtful choice would be "Born on the Fourth of July," a moving biopic that follows the story of Ron Kovic, a war veteran who becomes an anti-war activist after feeling betrayed by his own country following the Vietnam War. Tom Cruise delivers a powerful performance in this emotional drama directed by Oliver Stone. Enjoy your movie time!
